markdownRemark.html: In her new book, Women, Language and Grammar in Italy 1500-1900 (British Academy, 2011), p. 46, n. 59, Helena Sanson says that there were over thirty five editions of the Libro maistrevole. I have not been able to verify this point, but if true, it would of course alter my statement here about Tagliente's reading of his audience.
